3.3 Business Plan.
3.3.1 Conduct of Business. The Company shall conduct its Business in conformity with a business plan jointly
prepared and agreed to by the Parties on or prior to the Effective Date, as may be amended from time to time after the Effective
Date with the unanimous approval of the Board (the “Business Plan”). In case where the Parties have not agreed on the Business
Plan as of the date hereof, then the Parties shall continue to discuss in good faith immediately following the execution of this
Agreement and agree on the Business Plan prior to the Effective Date.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.3 Business Plan.
3.3.1 Conduct of Business. The Company shall conduct its Business in conformity with a business plan jointly
prepared and agreed to by the Parties on or prior to the Effective Date, as may be amended from time to time after the Effective
Date with a simple majority approval of the Board (the “Business Plan”). In case where the Parties have not agreed on the Business
Plan as of the date hereof, then the Parties shall continue to discuss in good faith immediately following the execution of this
Agreement and agree on the Business Plan prior to the Effective Date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Business Plan can only be amended with unanimous approval of the Board, but the modified text changes this to a simple majority. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the level of approval required for amending the Business Plan, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.changed_text:
4.7 Actions Requiring Unanimous Board Approval. The Parties agree that the following matters require the unanimous
approval of the Directors present at a properly-noticed Board meeting,
and no Shareholder shall convene a shareholders meeting with respect to the following matters without the prior written consent of
the other Shareholder:
4.7.1 revising the budget or Business Plan of the Company; however, any revisions to the Business Plan require only a simple majority of the Board.
perturbation.explanation: The original text of Section 4.7 clearly states that revising the Business Plan requires unanimous board approval. The added phrase now says that revisions require only a simple majority. This is a direct in-text contradiction that creates uncertainty about the decision-making process.

perturbation.original_text:
9.1 AFSL’s Right to Require the Purchase of the Shares by TPH or TPH-A.
9.1.1 As longs as AFSL and FSL are not in material and continuing breach of this Agreement or the Ancillary
Agreements, FSL or AFSL may trigger the option to sell the Put Shares to TPH-A or its designee (the “Put Option”) by providing
a written notice of the exercise of the Put Option (the “Put Exercise Notice”) simultaneously to the Company, TPH and TPH-A,
which notice states (i) such Party’s bona fide intention to exercise the Put Option, and (ii) the date on which such Party intends that
the Put Closing Date occur.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.1 AFSL’s Right to Require the Purchase of the Shares by TPH or TPH-A.
9.1.1 As longs as AFSL and FSL are not in material and continuing breach of this Agreement or the Ancillary
Agreements, FSL or AFSL may trigger the option to sell the Put Shares to TPH-A or its designee (the “Put Option”) by providing
a written notice of the exercise of the Put Option (the “Put Exercise Notice”) simultaneously to the Company, TPH and TPH-A,
which notice states (i) such Party’s bona fide intention to exercise the Put Option, and (ii) the date on which such Party intends that
the Put Closing Date occur. However, AFSL must provide a guarantee of 10 million USD that will secure TPH-A's possible loss due to the Put Option.
perturbation.explanation: Section 9.1.1 originally describes the conditions under which AFSL can exercise its put option. The added text introduces a new condition, a $10 million USD guarantee, which contradicts the original terms and creates uncertainty. Whether AFSL is required to provide a guarantee to exercise its put option is now ambiguous, affecting the enforceability of this section.
